title: James Short named Aviva Premiership Player of the Month
title_page: James Short named Aviva Premiership Player of the Month | Daily Mail Online
text:
Exeter Chiefs wing James Short has been named the Aviva Premiership Rugby Player of the Month for February after his stunning form helped them go the whole month unbeaten.
Short's best moment of the month came when he scored a hat-trick in Exeter's 48-32 win over Worcester Warriors, in which he also carried 21 times for 152 metres and beat nine Worcester defenders.
It was enough for England's World Cup winning Will Greenwood to say: 'James is a player I have long admired. He has great work rate, energy, desire.
Exeter Chiefs wing James Short poses with his Aviva Premiership Player of the Month award
PREVIOUS WINNERS December – Tom Varndell (Bristol) November – Freddie Burns (Leicester) October – Mako Vunipola (Saracens) September – Jimmy Gopperth (Wasps)
'James is a team player and has to wait for games sometimes. But when opportunities are offered he gobbles them up as well as the tries!'
The 27-year-old has started 25 matches for the Chiefs since joining from London Irish in 2015, touching down 19 times and accumulating 95 points.
In total, he has 170 Premiership points to his name.
The wing could be given a chance to impress on the big stage next weekend when Exeter take on Leicester Tigers in the Anglo-Welsh Cup final at the Stoop.
Short was involved in a three-way battle for this month's title, eventually beating two other wings: Sale Sharks Denny Solomona and Vereniki Goneva from Newcastle Falcons.
Short wins a trophy and a £250 donation to the charity of his choice.
